metadata.title: CVE-2017-15429 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Inappropriate implementation in V8 WebAssembly JS bindings in Google Chromeprior to 63.0.3239.108 allowed a remote attacker to inject arbitraryscripts or HTML (UXSS) via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15429` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 63.0.3239.132-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 63.0.3239.132-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 63.0.3239.132-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 63.0.3239.132-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 63.0.3239.132-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '63.0.3239.132-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
